resources.string:
Enabled: Whether IFU is enabled or not

 Fast: When enabled, the unlocking animation is skipped, making the unlock faster

 Force Unlock: Will unlock regardless of what's on the lock screen

 Allow Exceptions: Won't unlock if there are exceptions on the lock screen

 Exceptions: Any kind of notification element

 Music: If any media controller is active (such as Spotify or Google Play Music), auto-unlock won't activate

 Dismissables: If there are notifications that can be dismissed, auto-unlock won't activate

 Allow Non-Dismissables: Same as above, but if for non-dismissable notifications

 Only Delay With Notifications: The unlock delay will only apply if there is a notification

 Reveal Sensitive Notifications: Will reveal the content of a sensitive notification upon unlock. Enable hiding notifications in your phone's settings

 Vibration: Will vibrate once the device is auto-unlocked

 Duration: How long the vibration lasts in milliseconds

 Delay: Will auto-unlock your device a specified number of seconds after face scan is completed

Unfortunately, custom preferences for IFU is not yet supported on Android Pie or above. It may be possible, but doesn\'t seem to be working as it did in Oreo. If you\'d like to contribute to the project to enable this feature then you\'re welcome to check out the IFU Github project.

Instant Face Unlock has been installed on an SD card. In order to work properly, it must be moved onto your internal storage. However, because the app has been opened before you moved it, you need to uninstall it completely. Once it is installed again, move it from your SD card to your internal storage BEFORE doing a reboot. I hope to fix this in a future update, apologies for the inconvenience.
